items.snippet:

metatags.dc.description:
본 발명은 메인프레임 시스템 환경을 개방형 시스템 환경으로 전환하는 리호스팅 방법에 관한 것으로, 기업의 데이터를 처리하는 메인프레임 시스템 환경에서의 하드웨어(H/W)와 소프트웨어(S/W)를 개방형 시스템 환경으로 재구축하고, 데이터(DATABASE, 일반 FILE 포함)를 개방형 시스템 환경으로 전환하며, 응용프로그램을 재사용함으로써, 저 비용으로 단기간 내에 구현할 수 있으며 유지비 절감 효과가 탁월하다. 
       
     메인프레임 시스템, 개방형 시스템, 유닉스, 하드웨어, 소프트웨어, 응용프로그램, 데이터, 리호스팅
metatags.dc.title: 메인프레임 시스템 환경을 개방형 시스템 환경으로전환하는 리호스팅 방법

metatags.dc.description: A method is provided that includes receiving process-related information describing a process for production of a product, and the process-related information includes a logical sequence of operations (902) for producing respective internal products of the process. The method also includes scheduling for the process based on process-related information, wherein the process schedule is for execution of at least a portion of the operations (902), each of at least some of the operations (902) Temporarily use or require inputs that include the last input. Scheduling a process may include setting each of at least some of each of the tasks 902 as a closure portion that requires the availability of the last input of the task before starting and a separate closure portion that may be started before each last input is available Into a precursor portion 906 of the second set of pixels. Closure portions 904 of each task 902 may be arranged in a temporally sequential manner without intervening precursor portions 906 and

metatags.dc.description: Energy analysis systems provide valuable input to building energy expenditures. The system helps to investigate in detail how energy consumption occurs in buildings, what actions can be taken to lower the energy footprint, and to conduct detailed energy consumption analysis. The analysis is, for example, an equilibrium point pair analysis that determines one or both of heating and cooling equilibrium points, an exception identifying specific data (eg, energy consumption data) at specific time intervals for further review. Ranking analysis, or other analysis. The system can display the analysis results in a user interface.
metatags.citation_reference: 이승복. 회귀분석에 의한 건물에너지 사용량 예측기법에 관한 연구. 설비공학논문집, 12(12), pp1090~1097(2000.12)*
metatags.dc.title: Building energy consumption analysis system

metatags.dc.description: Receiving a downlink signal comprising an uplink access configuration index, using an uplink access configuration index to identify an uplink access configuration from a predetermined plurality of uplink access configurations, The method and apparatus in fifth generation wireless communication comprising a method in an example wireless device, comprising transmitting to a wireless communication network. The exemplary method includes receiving, in a first downlink sub-frame, a first orthogonal frequency-division multiplexed (OFDM) transmission formatted according to a first numerology, in a same wireless device, And receives a second OFDM transmission formatted according to a second numerology, wherein the second numeric is different from the first numeric, wherein the first numeric has a first subcarrier space and the second numerical 2 subcarrier space, and the first subcarrier space is different from the second subcarrier space. Variations of this method, corresponding apparatus, and corresponding network-s
metatags.dc.title: Multiplexing of sub-frames having different sub-carrier spaces

metatags.dc.description: Embodiments of the present invention present improved features of the mobile broadband routable Internet for environments, markets, management systems, web applications, mobile applications, devices, and the like, wherein a plurality of mobile devices are configured as nodes in a mobile ad-hoc network. Function, packets are IP routable for individual devices independently for fixed infrastructure elements. Certain environments are implemented for the mobile broadband routable internet by at least one enabler in connection with the mobile broadband routable internet.

metatags.dc.description: Agent adapter architectures (100, 210, 310) and message objects used in systems and methods for integrating applications (100) of the type typically deployed across network enterprises are disclosed. Agent 210 encapsulates a plurality of adapters 222, 226, 224, each of which is adapted to perform a separate function associated with each of the plurality of enterprise applications. Such agents 222, 226, 224 are extensible and include one or more embedded objects 230-240. Each embedded object is similarly applied to perform a separate function that may or may not be associated with each of a plurality of enterprise applications. The message object includes a message schema that is applied for use with a plurality of accessors and a plurality of converters. The message schema is a hierarchical data structure that includes a plurality of section elements 620, a plurality of table elements 640, and a plurality of message elements selected from a plurality of item elements 660. Item element 660 includes raw data fo
metatags.dc.title: Scalable distributed enterprise application integration system

metatags.dc.description: Various embodiments are disclosed for a service policy communication system and method. In some embodiments, the communication device implements a service policy to help control the communication device usage of the service on the network; Service usage is monitored based on service policy, and local service usage is synchronized with network-based service usage.
metatags.dc.title: Verifiable device assisted service usage monitoring with reporting, synchronization, and notification

metatags.dc.description: Various embodiments of a service policy communication system and method are disclosed. In some embodiments, the communication device implements a service policy to assist in billing the service's use of the communication device on the network; Monitoring the use of services based on service policies, and the use of local services are synchronized with the use of network-based services.

metatags.dc.description: Systems and methods are disclosed for opening patient-specific treatments based on dynamic modeling of patient-specific physiology. The system includes at least a computer with information on which data collection protocols are defined that define the type of patient-specific data collected and how the patient-specific data will be collected, and a patient-specific model configured to simulate aspects of the patient's physiology. It includes a software module configured to provide access via. Other software modules of the system are configured to provide patient-specific data collected in accordance with a data collection protocol to the patient-specific model, providing computer-based access to determine patient-specific treatment.
metatags.dc.title: Systems and methods for developing patient-customized treatments based on modeling of patient physiology
